intro: Pseudosabicea arborea, commonly known as the tree sabicea, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers clustered in umbels. It produces small, round berries that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. Pseudosabicea arborea is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands.
